meanings.definition: The quality or state of being stiff or unnatural in manner or speech.
meanings.sent1: Her stiltedness in conversation made everyone feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The actor's stiltedness on stage was evident to the audience.
meanings.sent3: Despite his stiltedness, he managed to make us all laugh with his awkward jokes.
meanings.sent4: The stiltedness of her movements was like watching a robot trying to dance.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stiltedness in explaining the concept left the students confused.

meanings.definition: The act of walking on stilts.
meanings.sent1: The children's stiltedness at the circus amazed the crowd.
meanings.sent2: She practiced her stiltedness in the backyard before the parade.
meanings.sent3: The stiltedness of the performers added a fun twist to the street fair.
meanings.sent4: Their stiltedness on stilts made them look like giants walking among us.
meanings.sent5: The stiltedness of the stilt walkers brought a sense of wonder to the event.
